descriptionNullable:
**Context and Content:**

This data was was gathered and investigated for the Google Analytics Capstone Project and was used to solve a business question of my creation for an imaginary company. The business question being stated was, "What characteristics of an anime can we use to ensure an anime's success for an American audience?" As this was for a business, I decided to exclude all "Ecchi" series as I had decided the company I was working for was wanting to steer clear of that genre.

The data came from two sources for three separate charts. The data came from Myanimelist, an anime rating database with a high American ratio. IMDb, a more general database of movies and shows that includes anime but with less of a focus on it. MAL_V5 is the hand typed data set as there wasn't a good means of gathering the data automatically with the tools I had. It includes the top 250 anime rated on the website as of early March. As it was hand typed and a database, some of the anime moved ranks as I was finishing up typing, but many have stayed or only adjusted slightly when I finished. IMDb is also a database, but I was able to select the top 500 shows and movies overall for one sheet and 500 anime (the first ones that popped up that I recognized as anime) for another sheet. These were individually chosen but acquired auto-generated data from IMDb for them.

**Acknowledgement:**

Image from Vivy Fluorite Eye's Song

Myanimelist: https://myanimelist.net/

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/

**Inspiration: **

- What characteristics are the most impactful?

- How good does an anime need to be to have a good viewership.
title: Anime Characteristics and Success
subtitle: What works in Anime?
